articles.description: The future of hundreds of homeless people recently removed from the Santa Ana River trail in Orange County and temporarily housed in area motels will be the focus of a federal judge's hearing Saturday in Santa Ana. More than 700 homeless people were moved las…

articles.title: Santa Monica tries a balancing act as it deals with burgeoning street vending along beaches, pier
articles.description: The sun set over the Santa Monica Pier as Ana Ortiz sold fresh fruit to tourists and kept an eye out for police. The 21-year-old and her mother, uncle, cousin and other family members earned a living in the city as street vendors. “It’s like a regular job,” s…

articles.author: Hannah Fry, Doug Smith
articles.title: Frustrated judge demands O.C. find shelter for homeless being evicted from camps
articles.description: Orange County’s decision to remove hundreds of homeless people from encampments along the Santa Ana River has turned into a legal showdown over how the affluent region treats some of its most needy citizens, a battle being watched by other areas struggling wi…

articles.author: Hannah Fry
articles.title: Newport Beach man accused of waterboarding wife, holding her captive
articles.description: A 36-year-old Newport Beach man is facing multiple felony charges that he beat and tortured his 65-year-old wife in their home in January, according to Orange County Superior Court records. Senior Deputy Dist. Atty. Mark Geller told City News Service that Ric…

articles.author: Makeda Easter
articles.title: Santa Monica tries balancing act as it deals with burgeoning street vending along beaches, pier
articles.description: Santa Monica has wrestled with street vending for years. On the one hand, officials argue, the sale of unregulated food can cause health risks. But they worry that, without decriminalization, immigrants who ply their trade are more vulnerable to deportation.

articles.title: Muslim woman sues Ventura County Sheriff's Department, says deputies forced her to remove hijab while jailed
articles.description: A Muslim woman filed a federal lawsuit against the Ventura County Sheriff’s Department on Monday, claiming deputies forced her to remove her head scarf while in custody last year, a move that runs counter to established case law protecting the religious right…

articles.title: Garcetti says L.A. can resume disputed ban on overnight sidewalk sleeping

articles.description: L.A.'s dance scene is hot, drawing artists from other parts of the country and the world. To help make sense of the evolving landscape, here's a select list of new and veteran troupes that should be on your dance card.
